issue.title: [Format] UUID type
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-2152](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2152). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Add a UUID type that is physically represented as an 128bit fixed sized binary. The addition of the type should add the annotation that a value in this column is a UUID. The important benefit would be that in the native language object models we could return the respective UUID class, e.g. `java.util.UUID` in Java and `uuid.UUID` in Python. For reference, Postgres and Parquet both have a UUID type as well do other data system have this small specialization.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2152?focusedCommentId=16415197) by Omer Katz (the_drow):*
Possible duplicate of https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2051

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2152?focusedCommentId=17201547) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Now that we have extension types, I would recommend closing this. What do you think `[~uwe]` ?
